label: uncl4017
comment: Code specifying the level of commitment to a delivery plan.

values.label: Firm
values.comment: Indicates that the scheduling information is a firm commitment.

values.label: Commitment for manufacturing and material
values.comment: Authorizes the supplier to start the manufacturing of goods.

values.label: Commitment for material
values.comment: Authorizes the manufacturer to order material required for manufacturing specified goods.

values.label: Planning/forecast
values.comment: An estimate of future requirements based on trends and actual information.

values.label: Short delivered on previous delivery
values.comment: Part of a consignment which was not delivered when the original delivery was made.

values.label: Capacity available
values.comment: Capacity is available to meet the requested scheduling demands.

values.label: Promotion
values.comment: All related schedule information refer to a promotion.

values.label: Special demand
values.comment: All related schedule information refers to a special demand.

values.label: User defined
values.comment: The user can interpret the meaning of the values from information exchanged previously.

values.label: Immediate
values.comment: Indicates that the scheduling information is for immediate execution.

values.label: Pilot/Pre-volume
values.comment: Initial products required in advance of the normal production process.

values.label: Planning
values.comment: An estimate of future requirements.

values.label: Potential order increase
values.comment: The possibility and magnitude of a schedule fluctuation.

values.label: Average plant usage
values.comment: The usual amount that a manufacturing facility will use over a specified duration.

values.label: First time reported firm
values.comment: Initial confirmation of a material requirement.

values.label: Maximum
values.comment: The highest attainable amount.

values.label: Tooling capacity
values.comment: The maximum amount that the process was designed to accommodate.

values.label: Normal tooling capacity
values.comment: The anticipated amount that the process was designed to accommodate over a specific period of time.

values.label: Prototype
values.comment: The preliminary version of a product or service.

values.label: Strike protection
values.comment: Product level that is set aside as protection in the event of a work stoppage.

values.label: Required tooling capacity
values.comment: The contracted amount that the process was designed to accommodate over a specific period of time.

values.label: Deliver to schedule
values.comment: Deliver to schedule separately supplied.

values.label: Await manual pull
values.comment: Await non-EDI instruction before shipping.

values.label: Reference to commercial agreement between partners
values.comment: The buyer's commitment is the one defined in the commercial agreement.

values.label: Proposed
values.comment: Indicates that the scheduling information is a proposal.
